channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Followup ref: 7650603 - pigeon spikes damaged, 17th June
item.description:
Hi, the status for 7650603. is 'not the council's responsibility'. Whose responsibility is it then, &who can this be reported to? If the purpose of Fixmystreet is to refer problems to whichever authority is most appropriate, please let them know who
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mentmore Terrace, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Human excrement in Caldew Street, SE5 7LB, 17th June
item.description:
I reported human excrement in Caldew Street a couple of days ago and was told that my complaint had been dealt with and was now closed. But it has not been fixed and the excrement is still there. If you can't locate it exactly please ring my doorbell at No34 Addington Square and I will show you exactly where it is.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Addington Square, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Human Fouling (urination) every day outside baker street mobiles, 17th June
item.description:
I have a small business outside baker street station (front of accessorize), homeless people are doing urination every night in front of the shop door. my business is almost shut due to the smell and mess; the whole pathway needs proper wash and council need to help to stop people to doing that by security camera or inspectors.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cornwall Terrace Mews, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Likely abandoned, 17th June
item.description:
Man left car at 9am Thursday 10th June. Car window is open and collecting sap. Untaxed, no MOT. Likely dumped as new log book generated the day after the car was left.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, Canberra Road, Charlton, London

item.title: Garbage accumulating in front of abandoned pub, 17th June
item.description:
It is unacceptable that this amount of garbage and neglect is tolerated on one of the central roads in Lewisham. It is an eyesore and could become a pest hazard if not taken care of. Shameful.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 162, Lee High Road, Hither Green, London

item.title: Parked cars on yellow line., 17th June
item.description:
Parked Cars on road, opposite bus stop causing traffic jams. Sign on lamppost saying no parking Monday to Saturday 8.30 to 6.30. People park cars there and walk to station. Please confirm if you can park there, as it is a great location to park my car and walk to station. Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hatherley Crescent, Longlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet
